Preheat a pan and let the steak come to room temperature.
Season the steak generously and let it sit for 20 minutes.
Sear the steak in a hot pan, focusing on the fat and bone.
Add garlic and fresh herbs to enhance the flavor.
Flip the steak when necessary and continue searing until crispy.
Add butter and baste the steak while it rests.
Prepare chimichurri sauce with shallots, mint, cilantro, and oregano.
Season the sauce with salt, pepper, garlic, and smoked paprika.
Drizzle with extra virgin olive oil and lemon juice.
Serve the steak with mashed potatoes and a generous amount of chimichurri.
